intro: Corymbis bolusiana, commonly known as the Bolus's corymbia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers arranged in corymbs. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
